name: Upgopher
description: A simple Go web server for file upload, download, and browsing. Cross-platform alternative to Python-based file servers with no library dependencies. Features file upload via web interface, directory navigation, URL copying to clipboard, optional basic authentication, HTTPS support, and hidden files toggle.

notes.text: Default: HTTP on port 9090, no authentication, uploads dir: /opt/upgopher/uploads

To customize: edit /etc/systemd/system/upgopher.service and modify ExecStart line. Available flags: -user <user> -pass <pass> (authentication), -ssl (HTTPS with self-signed cert), -port <port> (custom port), -dir <path> (upload directory), -disable-hidden-files (hide hidden files)
Example with auth: ExecStart=/opt/upgopher/upgopher -port 9090 -dir /opt/upgopher/uploads -user admin -pass mysecret
After editing service file: systemctl daemon-reload && systemctl restart upgopher
